be.kuleuven.micas.signalStorage.interfaces
Interface LoadableSignalDatabase

All Superinterfaces:
IndexedSignals, MetaInfo, NamesIndex, java.io.Serializable, SignalDatabase
All Known Implementing Classes:
LoadableSignalDatabaseImpl, SimulationCompressedUWI, SimulationHSpiceAscii, SimulationHSpiceCSDF, SimulationNonCompressedUWI, SimulationPsfAscii
public interface LoadableSignalDatabase
extends SignalDatabase

ReloadableSimulationOutput is an interface that indicates that a SimulationOutput can be loaded.

All SimulationOutput files that can be loaded from disk should implement this interface

There are two sets of load commands: incrementalLoad and load.

incrementalLoad tries to load only the requested signals (in addition to the already loaded signals). If a change in timestamp of the file is detected, the entire file will be reloaded (all loaded signals). For many filetypes, incrementalLoad will not be much faster than a normal load.

load tries to load the data file from scratch. Normally, the header will be re-read. However, in situations where the header can not necessarily be derived from the filename (header is not part of file itself), and where the header information was handed as an object to the constructor of the class, this header is not reloaded, only the data file.

All load methods happen on the originally provided filenames (header en body)

The load methods should be updated to allow selective reading based on SignalFilters

Author:
scoseman

Method Detail

load

void load(java.lang.String regexpFilter,
          java.lang.String[] exactNames)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.util.ConcurrentModificationException,
                 SignalDoesNotExistException
Loads the indicated signals from the body source file (as set by getBodyFilename). Based on regular expression and list of exactNames

Parameters:
regexpFilter -
exactNames -
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the body file cannot be parsed
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException - if the file body has changed since the last reload (best effort detection)
SignalDoesNotExistException - if one of the exactNames does not provide a match

reload

void reload()
            throws java.io.IOException
Reload the file. Update all signals that were previously available. Only if the body file has been updated, an actual reload is performed (checked by timestamp). If the header was provided as a filename, it will also be reloaded if it has changed.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the body file or the header file cannot be read correctly

isFileUpdated

boolean isFileUpdated()
check whether the backing database file has been changed since last reload operation

Returns:
true if changed, false if not changed

getSourceDescription

java.lang.String getSourceDescription()
Return a String that provides information about the file by which this database is backed up. Load signals will retrieve data from this source.

For most readers, this call should simply return the filename of the file that has been read.

For readers with a separate header and body, it should provide both, separated with a "; "

Code should not depend on the exact form of this field
